perturbation.changed_text:
J.
In a good faith effort for mutual benefits, neither party shall be held liable for any sort of unexpected damages incurred, which is up to the discretion of the court if there is any conflicts.
perturbation.explanation: Moving the liability clause to a different section, reduces the chances of it being enforceable. The original clause clearly limits the liability of ABG and Celebrity. The modified clause introduces ambiguity by referring to 'discretion of the court,' potentially undermining the original intent of limiting liability and making enforcement unpredictable.

perturbation.original_text:
9. Arbitration. In the event a dispute arises under this Agreement which cannot be resolved, such dispute shall be submitted to arbitration
and resolved by a single arbitrator (who shall be a lawyer) in accordance with the Commercial Arbitration Rules of the American Arbitration
Association then in effect. All such arbitration shall take place at the office of the American Arbitration Association located in or nearest to New
York, New York. Each Party is entitled to depose at least two (2) fact witnesses and any expert witness designated by the other Party, and to
conduct such other discovery as the arbitrator deems appropriate. The award or decision rendered by the arbitrator shall be final, binding and
conclusive and judgment may be entered upon such award by any court.
perturbation.changed_text: H. Equitable Relief. In the event a dispute arises, the parties will consider arbitration, however, nothing in the section requires the two parties to arbitrate, and the final decision for arbitration lies between the two parties. The decision rendered after considering arbitration shall be determined by the parties, non-binding and non-conclusive.
perturbation.explanation: Relocating the arbitration clause introduces contradiction—the clause states arbitration will be the method of resolution in the event of a dispute, and the arbitration process is subject to both parties agreeing, meaning the arbitration process is not mandatory. The modification undermines the enforceability of arbitration.

perturbation.changed_text:
E. 
Both Parties must try to comply with some rules, regulations, laws, orders, decrees, and ordinances. However, since it is practically impossible to comply with every regulation out there, there is no direct guarantee for 100% compliance of the rules. It is up to the Party itself to try to adhere to the rules as much as possible.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause mandates compliance with all applicable laws. The modified clause introduces ambiguity and undermines the original commitment to compliance, suggesting that it is not always possible to fully comply with all regulations. The enforcement is uncertain.
